text.p: Asia Equity Ltd said on Wednesday it had reduced its earnings forecast of Shinawatra Computer and Communication Plc due to an expected fall in profits from its subsidiaries and other sources.

Asia Equity said in a new report that Shinawatra, Thailand's major telecommunication conglomerate, was expected to post a net profit of 2.1 billion baht ($80.77 million) in 1997 compared with 2.63 billion in 1996.
Asia Equity said it had previously projected the earnings of Shinawatra to be at 2.66 billion baht this year.
"The major change in our forecasts is a significant reduction in Shinawatra's share of associates' profits and other income by 80-90 percent," Asia Equity said.
The earnings of Shinawatra and its affiliates will be adversely affected by the country's economic downturn, it said.
Despite the lower earnings forecast, Shinawatra was still rated a buy due to its cheap market price compared with its book value, it said.
